newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico eyes lifting milk price controls - Labastida.
newsitem.headline: Mexico eyes lifting milk price controls - Labastida.

text.p: Mexican Agriculture Minister Francisco Labastida Ochoa said Tuesday the government was eyeing lifting price controls on pasteurized milk.
"It is under discussion and analysis at this moment," Labastida told Reuters in an interview. He gave no indication of when a decision might be made.
Dairymen and farm leaders have pressed the government for the last six months to lift controls on such milk.
Price restrictions on long-life milk ended in March. The price of pasteurised milk was also raised to 3.60 pesos from 2.75 pesos, but price controls remained in place.
--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom (525) 7289530. E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com
